entry.title: For Life.
entry.summary:
Author: power_moves

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,579Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 118

Summary: "Buck didn't have a daughter. Sure, he loved kids and maybe one day he would build his own little family, but not right now. He just couldn't bear this type of responsibility - the kind that demanded more than he was able to give, more than he thought he could handle.Then one phone call suddenly changed everything.A number he didn't recognize. A professional voice talking to him, her words not making sense. "Her birth certificate states that you're her father."" Or Buck learns he has a seventeen year old daughter that just lost her mom and is now supposed to live with him. TW: old injuries, pain, emotional distress

entry.title: punishment fits the crime
entry.summary:
Author: lexisdelusional

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,810Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: “Five minutes is a long time!” he squeals, or maybe whines. His voice comes out far too high and cracks halfway through, making Chim snort—though at Buck’s petulant glare he plays it off like he was choking on his drink.   “Chim’s right. We all agreed."   “It’s in writing,” Chim stage-whispers.   “Not helping,” Hen snips, flicking his forehead. “I promise, Buck, it’ll go by fast once you’re up there.”   “I hate all of you,” Buck spits. He turns to Eddie, pointing a finger against his chest. “Especially you.” *** or: Buck loses the 118's fantasy football league

entry.title: Ghost
entry.summary:
Author: Karin1232

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,823Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 92

Summary: “Don’t worry about me. I’ve got ten bucks left. Coffee’s fine. I’ll leave the rest for you. Merry Christmas, right?” He tried to smile, but it faltered, collapsing under the weight of everything he carried. Behind him, Eddie had just walked in, shaking the cold from his jacket. He hadn’t expected to see Buck there, hadn’t expected to hear the words spilling out of him like confessions too heavy to hold. OR Buck goes to grab some coffee and Eddie overhears his conversation with the waitress.

entry.summary:
Author: WhereFirefliesLand

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 105,091Chapters: 25/?Kudos: 671

Summary: Buck's used to being loud and taking up space. But lately, it feels like everyone else is talking without him. Tommy's too busy with his newfound popularity. He just doesn't know what it means yet.

entry.title: First Steps To Are Forever
entry.summary:
Author: villayuly1987

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,258Chapters: 14/20Kudos: 23

Summary: It wasn’t supposed to be more than friendship—just support, just family, just being there. But somewhere between takeout nights, shared laughter, and long shifts that blurred into dawn, Buck realizes the truth he’s been running from: he’s not orbiting Eddie out of loyalty. He’s falling. Hard. With every small act of care—every folded sweater, every cleaned dish, every stolen glance—Buck feels himself pulled closer to a truth too dangerous to name. Because once he admits what his heart already knows, there’s no going back. Or will he slip away

entry.title: S3 Superwoman: Last Responder
entry.summary:
Author: That_bitch_without_a_life

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,335Chapters: 10/14Kudos: 61

Summary: Buck could ring her hands over and over. it was bad enough that she got blown up by a fire truck. It was bad enough she'd spent 5 months under lock and key. She really does not need to be dealing with all this bullshit, whatever god looks after humanity is cruel. At least now she has somebody to lean on, at least now Eddie knows the truth and she'll be back on the team soon enough. TLDR: this is a female buck fic if she was supergirl, just trust the process.

Summary: It seems, his best friends have a tendency to think he is very legal guardian-shaped.Buck has never been more heartbroken about it. Or:Buck's childhood friends unexpectedly die, and he finds himself a sole guardian of three kids. Now he needs to glue all their hearts together, learn to raise a moody teenager and two girls under 10, and still manage to be a firefighter. Oh, and has he mentioned that he needs to do it while moving kids literal states?He's got it! Right?! Right?...

entry.title: We Can't Be Friends (Wait For Your Love)
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,405Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 19

Summary: Evan Buckley is larger than life. He is the face seen on every blockbuster movie poster, the lead actor of every big TV drama of the past 10 years. Fans adore him due to his bubbly personality, deep commitment to philanthropic enterprises, and… you know… he’s a bit of a sight for sore eyes.Buck doesn’t know how he got here, really. It all started when he was 18, playing the titular role of Hamlet in a travelling theatre troupe. Apparently, an agent was in the audience, attempting to scout for untapped talent. After several rounds of auditions and a boatload of networking, he was soon considered the Next Big Thing.Suddenly, his face was everywhere, and he couldn’t leave the house without dozens of adoring fans flocking to his side. Autographs, selfies, kissing babies. These all became regular occurrences for Evan ‘Buck’ Buckley.To be clear, Buck loves his fans. He loves the messages he receives from them, those who truly resonate with his work. He’s never been adored in his life.But… he’s 28 now. And he’s never felt lonelier.-OrActor Evan ‘Buck’ Buckley studies how to be a firefighter by shadowing the 118.Title based on the Ariana Grande song.

entry.title: I can't speak, afraid to jinx it (I don't even dare to wish it)
entry.summary:
Author: titaniclikeship003

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,547Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 67

Summary: “Hello, my name is Christopher Diaz, and today, I will be answering this question: What do the holidays mean to me?” He paused, took a deep breath, found Buck and Eddie in the audience, and then continued with a smile on his face. Buck and Eddie both must have recognized the evil grin at the same time because they shifted uncomfortably like they were going to try to stop Chris as his first sentence rang out throughout the room.  “The holiday season, what it means, and how to survive it when your mom is dead.”
